trans-unit.source: You can find this sample in the tutorial project: Menu → Instantiating prefabs
trans-unit.target: You can find this sample in the tutorial project: Menu → Instantiating prefabs

trans-unit.source: This C# Beginner tutorial covers how to instantiate prefabs.
trans-unit.target: This C# Beginner tutorial covers how to instantiate prefabs.

trans-unit.source: A prefab is a "master" version of an object that you can reuse wherever you need. When you change the prefab, every instance of the prefab changes too.
trans-unit.target: A prefab is a "master" version of an object that you can reuse wherever you need. When you change the prefab, every instance of the prefab changes too.

trans-unit.source: A prefab that is instantiated by code does not give you a new prefab object, but instead gives you a list of entities. As long as these entities are not added to the scene, they wont be visible and attached scripts will not be executed.
trans-unit.target: A prefab that is instantiated by code does not give you a new prefab object, but instead gives you a list of entities. As long as these entities are not added to the scene, they wont be visible and attached scripts will not be executed.
